text: Why is foo(*arg, x) not allowed in Python?

code:
point = (1, 2)
size = (2, 3)
color = 'red'

class Rect(object):
    def __init__(self, x, y, width, height, color):
        pass

text: It would be very tempting to call:

code:
Rect(point[0], point[1], size[0], size[1], color)

Rect(*(point + size), color=color)

Rect(*(point + size + (color,)))

text: But why is Rect(*point, *size, color) not allowed, is there any semantic ambiguity or general disadvantage you could think of?
Why are multiple *arg expansions not allowed in function calls?
Why are positional arguments not allowed after *arg expansions?
